Creating a New Project

Send comments on this topic.

Project Concepts

FlashFX Tera uses the term "project" to refer to a custom configuration for a specific target platform, flash type, and operating system. Each project is stored in a unique location called the Project Directory. Many Project Directories may exist within a single FlashFX Tera installation.

FlashFX ships with a number of pre-configured projects for a variety of reference platforms. The SDK's readme.txt file contains a list of these projects.

The Project Directory contains the following items (among others):

  • Batch commands describing the characteristics of the project.
  • Header files for configuring common FlashFX Tera settings.
  • Header files for configuring common Datalight Common Library (DCL) settings.
  • Batch commands for initiating build and clean operations on the FlashFX Tera code tree.
  • The results of a FlashFX Tera build operation (libraries and/or binary device drivers).
The vast majority of FlashFX Tera configuration options are completely configurable from within the Project Directory. It is rare that other code elsewhere in the FlashFX Tera tree needs to be modified to configure and use FlashFX Tera.

Understanding ToolSets

FlashFX Tera uses a concept called a ToolSet to abstract the build process so that FlashFX Tera remains portable across many environments. The ToolSet abstraction is implemented in the dcl\host\win32 directory tree. Each ToolSet has a sub-directory under dcl\host\win32.

It is not necessary to understand how the ToolSet abstraction works in order to build FlashFX Tera. However, if you are using FlashFX with a tool chain which does not already have a ToolSet abstraction, you will need to create one if you want to use the standard Datalight build process. Note that using the Datalight build process is not a requirement to use FlashFX, it is simply a convenience. You are free to compile and link the FlashFX code in any fashion you desire.

When a new project is created using newproj.bat, the ToolSet name is specified as one of the parameters. The P_TOOLSET setting, stored in the prjinfo.bat file, permanently records this information for the new project.

FlashFX Tera supports the following ToolSets, though not every ToolSet ships in every FlashFX Tera SDK:

ADS12 - This ToolSet is used to build using ARM Developer's Suite v1.2.
DIABVX5X - This ToolSet is used to build using Wind River Diab tools for VxWorks 5.x.
DIABVX6X - This ToolSet is used to build using Wind River Diab tools for VxWorks 6.x.
GHS - This ToolSet is used to build using Green Hills tools.
GNUCS - This ToolSet is used to build using Code Sourcery GNU tools.
GNUVX5X - This ToolSet is used to build using Wind River GNU tools for VxWorks 5.x.
GNUVX6X - This ToolSet is used to build using Wind River GNU tools for VxWorks 6.x.
MARVELLSDT - This ToolSet is used to build using the Marvell Software Developer's Tool Suite.
MICROTEC - This ToolSet is used to build using the Microtec tools.
MSVS - This ToolSet is used to build using Microsoft Visual 6, as well as Visual studio 2003 and 2005.
MSWCE - This ToolSet is used to build using Microsoft Windows CE 4/5/6 command-line tools.
MSWCEPB - This ToolSet is used to build using Microsoft Windows CE 4.x Platform Builder.
RVDS - This ToolSet is used to build using the ARM RealView Developer's Suite.
TASKING - This ToolSet is used to build using the Altium Tasking tools.

Running NEWPROJ.BAT

Creating a new project is done by using the newproj.bat batch file, which resides in the root of the FlashFX Tera installation. Upon successful completion, NEWPROJ will create the specified project directory, copy the default project files into the directory, and generate a prjinfo.bat file. NEWPROJ has the following syntax:

C:\DL\FLASHFX> NEWPROJ productroot projectdir os cpu toolset [toolroot]

productroot - This must be the full path to the root of the FlashFX Tera installation.
projectdir - This is the location where the project is to reside. This location must be on the same drive that FlashFX Tera is installed on. The projectdir specification must be the full path, and must not refer to a directory that already exists.
os - This is the OS to use, which must always be lower case.
cpu - This specifies the CPU to target. For a list of supported CPUs within a given ToolSet, please refer to the ToolSet's CPUCHECK.BAT. Also, refer to the section on ToolSets within the Datalight Common Libraries documentation for further details.
toolset - This specifies the ToolSet to use. The ToolSet name must be specified in lower case.
[toolroot] - This specifies the root of the tool chain installation. If this value is not specified, an attempt will be made automatically to determine what it is.

Note -- The os, cpu, and toolset parameters must be specified in lower case.

Examining PRJINFO.BAT

NEWPROJ creates a prjinfo.bat file that contains the settings for the new project. Whenever a project is built, the FlashFX Tera build process calls prjinfo.bat to retrieve the settings for the project. A typical prjinfo.bat will look similar to the following: 

        REM ---------- Product/Project Settings ----------
        set P_ROOT=c:\dl\flashfx
        set P_PROJDIR=c:\dl\flashfx\projects\myproj
        set P_OS=wince
        set P_TOOLSET=toolsetname
        set P_TOOLROOT=c:\toolchainroot
        set P_CPUFAMILY=arm
        set P_CPUTYPE=xscale
        set P_PRIVATE=1


        REM --------------- Build Settings ---------------
        REM Define any product-wide C compiler flags to use
        set B_CFLAGS=

Project Files

When a new project is created, the following files will be placed in the Project Directory. These files are be described in more detail in the section on customizing your project.

prjinfo.bat - This batch file is used to configure the build process.
prjbuild.bat - This batch file is used to build FlashFX Tera.
prjclean.bat - This batch file is used to clean the FlashFX Tera project.
dclconf.h - This header file is used to configure DCL for your project.
ffxconf.h - This header file is used to configure FlashFX Tera for your project.
ffxmain.c - This file contains the FfxProjMain function for your project.
ffxproj.mak - This make file is used to build code in the Project Directory.

Cloning a Project

Sometimes it's easier to begin with a copy of an existing project rather than creating a new project from scratch. To clone a project, follow these steps:

  • XCOPY the original project directory to the new project directory.
  • Edit the prjinfo.bat file and change the P_PROJDIR value to the new directory specification.
  • If you copied the project from one FlashFX Tera installation to another, update the P_ROOT value in prjinfo.bat.
  • Depending on the kinds of changes you are planning to make, other changes to prjinfo.bat may also be necessary.
